title: Ironwork/Gates Font?
content:
Hello  
A few years ago I remember reading about (and possibly even purchasing) a font that mimics lettering in 18th-19th Century ironwork fencing/gates, like you would see on the gates to a public park, a large estate, castle, etc. (The images I'm uploading are the general idea)  
The font included not just the letterforms, but a way to create the horizontal/vertical iron bands and scrollwork that "held" the letters, also.  
I think it was called something like Covent Garden or Chelsea Garden, but I've done a search and can't find anything like that. Does this sound familiar to anyone? Any help would be greatly appreciated. Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804054506im_/http:/typophile.com/files/royal3bg_3878.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804054506im_/http:/typophile.com/files/w-ironwork_5211.JPG)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804054506im_/http:/typophile.com/files/nameplate_4551.jpg)
author: BrooklynRob
